sen.j: 長勢（ちょうせい、寛弘7年（1010年） - 寛治5年11月9日 (旧暦)（1091年12月21日））は、平安時代中期の仏師。
sen.e: Chosei was "busshi" (a sculptor of Buddhist statues) in the middle of the Heian period, whose birth year was 1010 (birth date unknown) and death date was December 21, 1091.

sen.j: 長勢の仏師としての事績はまず、康平7年（1064年）に広隆寺の日光・月光菩薩立像（重要文化財）、及び同寺の十二神将立像（国宝）を造立したことが挙げられる（『広隆寺来由記』）。
sen.e: According to "Koryu-ji Raiyu-ki" (the book on the history of Koryu-ji Temple), his first achievement as busshi was the making of "Nikko and Gakko Bosatsu Ritsuzo" (the standing statues of the Bodhisattva of Sunlight and the Bodhisattva of Moonlight, now designated as important cultural assets) and "Junishinsho Ritsuzo" (the standing statues of Twelve Heavenly Generals, now designated as a national treasure), both of which were crafted in 1064 and were enshrined in Koryu-ji Temple.

sen.j: また長勢は、法成寺（天喜6年＝1058年に焼失していた）の再興にも参加し、治暦元年（1065年）に金堂の造仏賞として、僧位に叙された。
sen.e: Also, Chosei took part in the restoration of Hojo-ji Temple, which burned down in 1058, and he was conferred in 1065 the priesthood in reward for the making of statues enshrined in its "Kondo" (main hall).

sen.j: 延久2年（1070年）には円宗寺金堂の造仏をも担当した。
sen.e: In 1070, he took charge of making statues enshrined in Enso-ji Temple's Kondo.

sen.j: この時、高さ二丈の毘盧遮那仏、一丈六尺の薬師如来と一字金輪仏頂、その他梵天・帝釈天・四天王の、合わせて９体の巨像群を同年10月から12月末にかけてのわずか2ヶ月間で作り上げた。
sen.e: On this occasion, he crafted a group of gigantic statues - in all, nine statues - in about two months (from October to December of the year), and the statues were "Birushanabutsu" (Birushana Buddha) of about 6.06 meter height, "Yakushi Nyorai" (Healing Buddha) of about 4.85 meter height, "Ichiji Kinrin Buccho" (the principal Buddha of the 'Court of the Perfected') of about 4.85 meter height, "Bonten" (Brahma, a major Hindu deity thought to be responsible for creating the world), "Taishakuten" (Commandar of Four Heavenly Kings), and "Shitenno" (Four Heavenly Kings).

sen.j: この功績により、大仏師覚如（円宗寺講堂の造仏を担当）とともに法眼に叙せられた。
sen.e: In reward for this achievement, he was conferred "hogan" (the second highest rank of Buddhist priests) along with the "Daibusshi" (master sculptor) Kakunyo, who took charge of making statues enshrined in Enso-ji Temple's "Kodo" (Auditorium).

sen.j: 長勢の最も名高い業績は法勝寺の造仏である。
sen.e: Chosei's most famous achievement was the making of statues enshrined in Hosho-ji Temple.

sen.j: まず講堂・阿弥陀堂の諸仏によって承暦元年（1077年）法印に昇叙され、応徳2年（1085年）に常行堂九体阿弥陀仏も造立した。
sen.e: First, he crafted the statues enshrined in its Kodo and "Amida-do Hall" (a hall that Amitabha Tathagata is enshrined), for which hoin was rewarded in 1077, and second, he crafted the nine statues of Amitabha Tathagata enshrined in its "Jogyo-do Hall" in 1085.
